page.title: 15Morwenstow - Beaches
page.content: Beaches here are only accessible at low tide by scrambling over rocky ridges from a neighbouring more access ible beach. Cliffs can only be scaled with extreme care. They are high and steep with a zig - zag geological formation. The rivers plunge over the cliffs forming spectacular waterfalls. There are several very large rocks not covered by the sea which are nesting places for gulls and shags. On a warm summer day seals can be seen hunting for fish in sandy bottomed pools. The flowers on the cliff edge and rocky slopes are superb, especially in spring and early summer. There are no large stretches of sand, only boulders of many shapes and sizes rounded by the sea. Hennacliff is the highest cliff on this bit of coastline. It can be best viewed from a small boat fishing for lobsters.
